channel.title: Louie’s Bistro – Chow Down Orlando
channel.description: Exploring all that Orlando has to offer.

item.title: Louie’s Bistro
item.dc:creator: justincox
item.description:

The post Louie’s Bistro appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
item.content:encoded:
Meat week wraps up here at Chow Down Orlando with a sandwich featuring classic filet mignon!

Louie’s Bistro, one of our favorite food trucks here in town, featured this amazing sandwich recently. It’s perfectly cooked filet topped with onions, mushrooms, and a homemade béarnaise sauce. The flavors in this sandwich, combined with the quality of the meat, took this sandwich to the level of greatness.

As always, you can fine Louie’s Bistro on twitter.

The post Louie’s Bistro appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.

item.title: Louie’s Bistro
item.dc:creator: justincox
item.description:
This is the Duck Confit with Port Wine Onion Jam and Carrots sandwich from Louie’s Bistro. It’s every bit as delicious as the title makes it sound. Louie’s is one of our favorites and it’s great options like this that make it so. You can follow Louie’s Bistro on twitter.

The post Louie’s Bistro appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
item.content:encoded:
This is the Duck Confit with Port Wine Onion Jam and Carrots sandwich from Louie’s Bistro. It’s every bit as delicious as the title makes it sound.

item.title: Louie’s Bistro
item.dc:creator: justincox
item.description:
Another one of our favorite trucks is Louie’s Bistro. This is the Jamaican Jerk Chicken Sandwich with Yuca Fries and Mango Mayo. The spice of the jerk was just enough for great flavor and was cooled by the awesome mango mayo. The yuca fries gave a nice crunch and change in texture. As always, Louie’s […]

The post Louie’s Bistro appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
item.content:encoded:
Another one of our favorite trucks is Louie’s Bistro. This is the Jamaican Jerk Chicken Sandwich with Yuca Fries and Mango Mayo. The spice of the jerk was just enough for great flavor and was cooled by the awesome mango mayo. The yuca fries gave a nice crunch and change in texture. As always, Louie’s Bistro hits a homerun.

You can find Louie’s Bistro on Twitter.

The post Louie’s Bistro appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.

item.title: Louie’s Bistro
item.dc:creator: justincox
item.description:
Once again, Louie’s Bistro hit’s a home run. You’re looking at the shrimp and grits with a bonus soft shelled crab. It seems like every time I eat from Louie’s Bistro he get’s me to try something I’ve never had before. First it was étouffée, then it was port wine onion jam, and on this […]

The post Louie’s Bistro appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
item.content:encoded:
Once again, Louie’s Bistro hit’s a home run.

You’re looking at the shrimp and grits with a bonus soft shelled crab. It seems like every time I eat from Louie’s Bistro he get’s me to try something I’ve never had before. First it was étouffée, then it was port wine onion jam, and on this occasion it was soft shelled crab. Something about eating the entire crab, shell and all, has never quite sat with me, but I figured since I hadn’t been let down yet I might as well go all in.

Man was it good. It was crispy and the crab meat was flavorful. The shrimp were perfectly battered and fried and were sitting on a bed of savory grits that had nice flavor and just the slightest of kicks. The whole meal was fantastic.

You can follow Louie’s Bistro on Twitter.

The post Louie’s Bistro appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.

item.title: Louie’s Bistro
item.dc:creator: justincox
item.description:
The last time I tried Louie’s Bistro, I learned what étouffée was. This time I tried out the turkey sandwich with port wine onion jam. Holy crap was this thing good! It’s chunks of moist turkey on a nice bun smothered in this onion jam. I really don’t know how to describe it, other than […]

The post Louie’s Bistro appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
item.content:encoded:
The last time I tried Louie’s Bistro, I learned what étouffée was. This time I tried out the turkey sandwich with port wine onion jam. Holy crap was this thing good! It’s chunks of moist turkey on a nice bun smothered in this onion jam. I really don’t know how to describe it, other than it’s fantastic.

There was also an interesting sounding menu item in “meat filled potato ball” so I figured I’d give it a try. It was kind of like what would happen if an empanada had a baby and we didn’t know if the father was a hushpuppy or a potato. It was different, but a nice appetizer.

Go and find where Louie’s Bistro is right now, you won’t regret it.

The post Louie’s Bistro appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.

item.title: Louie’s Bistro
item.dc:creator: justincox
item.description:
What you see here is one of the more unique food truck menu items in town. It comes from Louie’s Bistro and is a heaping portion of crawfish étouffée. I’ll admit, I had to ask what étouffée is when I saw it on the menu. I’m glad I did because there were a lot of tempting […]

The post Louie’s Bistro appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
item.content:encoded:
What you see here is one of the more unique food truck menu items in town. It comes from Louie’s Bistro and is a heaping portion of crawfish étouffée.

I’ll admit, I had to ask what étouffée is when I saw it on the menu. I’m glad I did because there were a lot of tempting things listed on the board, but once étouffée was described as “a brown rue made with the trinity” I knew I was in. It’s delicious. Mixed with the rice and with the addition of the crawfish and fried okra for a nice texture change, the whole meal is wonderful.

Not only is the Crawfish Étouffée one of the most interesting food truck options in town, it’s also one of the best values. It’s a surprising portion of food that comes with a drink. Louie’s Bistro is a serious contender among the food trucks here in town and worth your visit.

You can find Louie’s Bistro on Twitter.

The post Louie’s Bistro appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
